Module cathedral.game
Package de.fhkiel.ki.cathedral.game

Enum Class Turnable

java.lang.Object
java.lang.Enum<Turnable>
de.fhkiel.ki.cathedral.game.Turnable
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, Comparable<Turnable>, Constable
public enum Turnable extends Enum<Turnable>
The enum Turnable describes if a Building can be turned and has a different form in these Directions.

While a building can always be turned in any Direction, there are Buildings where these turned forms are identical.
To reduce the number of Possibilities in placing Buildings, Turnable defines if a Building has 4, 2 or 1 forms on the Board.
Since:
1.0

  • Enum Constant Details

    • No

      public static final Turnable No
      The is no point in turning the Building in other Directions, as they will have always the same form.

      Reduction from 400 max possible Turns to 100 max.
      Examples are Building.White_Tavern, Building.Black_Infirmary

    • Half

      public static final Turnable Half
      The Building has two forms. One in Direction._0 and one in Direction._90. The other Directions are the same as their mirror.

      Reduction from 400 max possible Turns to 200 max.
      Examples are Building.White_Bridge, Building.Black_Stable

    • Full

      public static final Turnable Full
      The Building has four distinct forms. One in each Direction.

      Examples are Building.Blue_Cathedral

    • getRealDirection

      public Direction getRealDirection​(Direction direction)
      Gets the possible Direction that corresponds to the given Direction.

      For Full this just returns the given Direction.
      For Half this returns Direction._0 for Direction._0 or Direction._180 and Direction._90 for Direction._90 or Direction._270.
      For No this returns Direction._0 for any given Direction.
      Parameters:
      direction - the Direction to convert
      Returns:
      the Direction that corresponds to the given Direction
